events.title: Black Saturday-affected towns told to leave before predicted wind change causes ‘dangerous’ fire conditions – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Wind change sparks new fires amid extreme hot weather in Victoria as three people remain missing Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Attorney general says PM took ‘time to get this right’ before calling Bondi royal commission Michelle Rowland, the attorney general, said the prime minister had taken “time to get this right” as the government prepared to call a federal royal commission after the Bondi terror attack. The prime minister and the government have listened to people, particularly the Australian Jewish community, and that listening has not been about politics, it’s about getting The right outcome for our national unity and our national security. This is an opportunity not only for voices to be heard in the form of a royal commission, but also to take recommendations forward and also to continue the important work that the government has been doing in the last four weeks or so to ensure that our response to this prioritises national security and social cohesion in the long term. Continue reading...

events.title: Yes, Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot is 'digitally undressing' women and children
events.description: Elon Musk’s AI Grok has been fiercely criticised in recent days, after the chatbot began generating sexualised images of women and girls, flooding the app with explicit content. Some of the images involve girls as young as 10 years old, sparking global backash. Multiple countries worldwide have demanded answers on how X on how the app will comply to its digital standards, or have referred the matter to their communications watchdogs. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Protests intensify in Iran as internet is shut down
events.description: Iranian state media has claimed "terrorist agents" from the US and Israel have set fires and sparked violence on the streets.

events.title: Protests sweep Iran despite internet shutdown as state TV warns of casualties
events.description: Iranian protesters shouted and marched through the streets into Friday morning, despite Iran's theocracy cutting off the nation from the internet and international telephone calls.

events.title: West Bank: UN report warns of ‘systematic asphyxiation’ of Palestinian rights
events.description: A sweeping UN human rights report released on Wednesday concludes that in the occupied West Bank, Israel is violating international law prohibiting racial segregation and apartheid, warning that the discriminatory practices have accelerated dramatically since late 2022 amid growing violence, repression and impunity.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua’s driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and “driving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property”. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Live: Russia says it fired Oreshnik hypersonic missile in massive attack on Ukraine
events.description: Russia on Friday said it targeted Ukraine’s infrastructure with a hypersonic Oreshnik missile as part of a massive overnight attack. The attack on Kyiv killed four people and injured at least 22, according to local authorities. The strikes came shortly after Moscow denounced a Western plan to station peacekeeping troops in Ukraine after a ceasefire agreement. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.

events.title: US federal agents shoot and wound two in Portland after Minnesota ICE killing
events.description: Federal immigration officers shot and wounded two people in a vehicle outside a Portland, Oregon hospital on Thursday, authorities said, a day after an officer killed a driver in Minnesota. Hundreds protested at an ICE building, as Oregon’s attorney general vowed to investigate and refer charges if warranted, said Friday.

events.title: Iran on the brink as protesters move to take two cities, appeal to Trump
events.description: Iranian security forces attack hospital in Ilam province and fire tear gas at wounded protesters as nationwide demonstrations escalate across multiple cities.

events.title: Gov Walz authorizes National Guard staging following fatal ICE shooting in Minneapolis
events.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz authorized staging of the National Guard after a fatal ICE shooting in Minneapolis, sparking heated debate over state and federal authority.

events.title: Victorian premier warns next few hours ‘most dangerous and difficult’ as three people remain missing in bushfires
events.description: A man, woman and child remain unaccounted for, authorities say, as the Longwood bushfire continues to burn out of control Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Victorian premier has warned that the next few hours will be the “most dangerous and difficult” as a wind change impacts bushfires across the state, with three people still unaccounted for and properties destroyed on Friday. On Friday evening, Jacinta Allan called on Victorians to follow emergency advice as “fires continue to unfold, right across the state”. Continue reading...

events.title: Mining firms Rio Tinto and Glencore restart $260bn merger talks
events.description: Deal would create world’s largest mining company and come almost a year after previous discussions failed Business live – latest updates Rio Tinto and Glencore have restarted talks over a merger that would create the world’s largest mining company. If a deal is agreed it would come almost a year after previous discussions between the two mining companies collapsed and create a global mining business with an enterprise value of more than $260bn (£193bn). Continue reading...

events.title: Police say 1 killed, 27 missing in landfill collapse in central Philippine city
events.description: A huge mound of garbage has collapsed in a waste segregation facility in a central Philippine city, killing one person and leaving at least 27 others missing

events.title: Global economy shows signs of steady but subdued growth
events.description: The global economy has shown resilience amid turbulence during the past year, including shifting trade policies – yet growth remains subdued and far below pre-pandemic levels, the UN said in a landmark report published on Thursday.

events.title: Venezuela crisis: UN aid effort continues amid political upheaval
events.description: Venezuela’s political shock has sharpened global attention on a country already facing one of the world’s largest humanitarian and displacement crises. For the United Nations, the priority remains unchanged: protecting lives, sustaining basic services and supporting Venezuelans at home and across the region.

events.title: Two weeks on, questions linger over targeting and impact of US airstrikes in Nigeria
events.description: Very little information has been shared about strikes in Sokoto state Two weeks after the US carried out Christmas Day airstrikes in north-west Nigeria on what it described as Islamic State fighters, questions remain over the specific group that was targeted and the operation’s impact. In the aftermath of the strikes, Donald Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform that “ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria , who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians” were hit with “numerous perfect strikes”. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump says he will meet Venezuela opposition leader Machado, and threatens drug cartel land strikes
events.description: Trump was once dismissive of María Corina Machado but said it would be a ‘great honour’ to accept her Nobel peace prize if she made the offer Donald Trump has said he plans to meet Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, days after launching an attack that resulted in the capture of the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, and threatened land strikes against drug cartels in Latin America. In the aftermath of that operation, the future governance of the South American country has remained an open question, with Trump over the weekend dismissing the idea of working with popular opposition leader Machado , saying “she doesn’t have the support within or the respect within the country.” Continue reading...

events.title: Russia hits Kyiv with large-scale strikes after rejecting peacekeeping plan
events.description: Russia launched a large-scale attack on Ukraine’s capital, setting apartment buildings ablaze and killing at least four people, Kyiv’s mayor said on Friday, after Moscow rejected a proposed post-war peacekeeping plan. Ukraine and its Western allies agreed this week that European troops would deploy following any ceasefire, as the war nears its fourth year.

events.title: Who was Renee Nicole Good, the woman killed by ICE?
events.description: A mother of three and award-winning poet, Good's sudden death sparks protests across the US.

events.title: Iran protests: UN warns against further bloodshed
events.description: As protests in the Iranian capital, Tehran – sparked by increasing economic hardship and a cost-of-living crisis – continued for a ninth day, the UN Secretary-General said he was “deeply saddened by the reported loss of life and injuries,” resulting from clashes between security forces and protesters.

events.title: Trump says he doesn’t need international law amid aggressive US policies
events.description: UN rapporteur tells Al Jazeera she is concerned that the world may be returning to an 'age of imperialism'.

events.title: Two wounded in a shooting with US federal agents in Portland, Oregon
events.description: Portland police have urged calm as the shooting remains under investigation, amid heightened tensions over ICE actions.

events.title: Almost 50 writers boycott Adelaide festival after it dumps pro-Palestine academic Randa Abdel-Fattah
events.description: Helen Garner and Miles Franklin winner Michelle de Kretser among 47 people who have pulled out of annual writers’ festival to protest Abdel-Fattah’s axing Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Adelaide festival has pulled down part of its website as dozens of speakers said they were boycotting writers’ week, after Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah was dumped from the lineup with the board citing “cultural sensitivity” concerns in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. The page promoting the schedule of authors, journalists, academics and commentators was “unpublished” on Friday following widespread condemnation of the board’s decision to remove Abdel-Fattah. Continue reading...

events.title: U.S. to exit 66 international organizations in further retreat from global cooperation
events.description: Most of the targets are U.N.-related agencies, commissions and advisory panels that focus on climate, labor and other issues that the Trump administration has categorized as catering to diversity and "woke" initiatives.

events.title: US: Protesters, officers clash after Minneapolis shooting
events.description: Protesters took to the streets outside the federal building in Minneapolis to voice their outrage a day after an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent fatally shot a woman.

events.title: World News in Brief: Storms in Syria, school attacks in Nigeria, strikes continue in southern Lebanon
events.description: Thousands of displaced people in northern Syria are struggling to cope with freezing conditions after a severe snowstorm struck dozens of displacement sites, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Socialist groups chant 'Killer Kristi' while escalating nationwide anti-ICE protests
events.description: Socialist and communist groups coordinate protests after the fatal ICE shooting in Minneapolis, targeting Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem.

events.title: Minneapolis protesters confront federal agents day after deadly shooting
events.description: Hundreds of protesters confronted federal agents in Minneapolis following the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by ICE on Thursday.

events.title: One dead, dozens trapped after giant landfill collapses in Philippines
events.description: Rescuers have pulled 12 injured sanitation workers from debris at the private landfill in Cebu City.

events.title: NASA ends ISS mission early after astronaut suffers medical issue
events.description: NASA said on Thursday it will return a crew from the International Space Station to Earth within days after an astronaut experienced a medical issue, marking the orbital lab’s first evacuation for health reasons. The agency said the unidentified crewmember is stable and the condition was not caused by an onboard injury or station operations.

events.title: Knife-wielding suspect killed in officer-involved shooting inside New York City hospital
events.description: Police fatally shot an armed suspect who allegedly barricaded himself with a patient and security guard at NewYork-Presbyterian Brooklyn Methodist Hospital Thursday night, police said.

events.title: Iranian military leader threatens preemptive attack after Trump comments
events.description: Iran army chief threatens preemptive military action after President Donald Trump warned the U.S. is "locked and loaded" if the regime kills protesters.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.description: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: 'War on immigrants': Dr. Castañeda deconstructs politisation/militarisation of US immigration policy
events.description: For thoughtful analysis and a deeper perspective on the deadly ICE shooting in Minneapolis, blocks away from the where police killed George Floyd, Nadia Massih welcomes Dr. Ernesto Castañeda, Director of the Center for Latin American Studies and the Immigration Lab at American University. Renee Nicole Good, aged 37, was gunned down at point blank range by an ICE agent as the mother of three tried to flee. Dr. Castañeda challenges the DHS narrative, questions the excessive use of force and addresses the militarisation of immigration enforcement.

events.title: Human Rights Council elects Indonesian candidate President for 2026
events.description: The UN Human Rights Council – the world’s principal defender of vulnerable people worldwide – has elected an Indonesian diplomat to be President for 2026 in a first for the country.

events.title: Two wounded in Portland shooting involving federal agents after DHS says vehicle 'weaponized' against them
events.description: Federal agents reportedly involved in Portland shooting that left two people wounded and hospitalized Thursday afternoon on Southeast Main Street.

events.title: Attempt to overturn the Gambia’s ban on FGM heard by supreme court
events.description: Case brought by Muslim leaders and MP follows failed 2024 bid and seen as part of global anti-women’s rights backlash A group of religious leaders and an MP in the Gambia have launched efforts to overturn a ban on female genital mutilation at the country’s supreme court. The court case, due to resume this month, comes after two babies bled to death after undergoing FGM in the Gambia last year. Almameh Gibba, an MP and one of the plaintiffs, tabled a bill to decriminalise FGM that was rejected by the country’s parliament in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Storm Goretti set to unleash snowy winter havoc on UK
events.description: The storm will bring intense winds and heavy snowfall to the UK, with weather warnings in place nationwide. It comes after the same system canceled flights and suspended bus services in France and the Netherlands.

events.title: Does the EU now deem the US 'less reliable in terms of security, defence and trade'?
events.description: In his annual speech to French ambassadors, Emmanuel Macron warned the US was "gradually turning away" from some of its allies and "breaking free from international rules" following the capture of Venezuela's leader Nicolas Maduro and the US president's designs on Greenland. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Nadia Massih welcomes Barry Andrews, Irish MEP (Renew Europe). Mr. Andrews breaks down the volatile geopolitical landscape sparked by Trump's fiery rhetoric with traditional allies and US military operations.

events.title: No call for reform: Amid nationwide protests, do Iranians envision new regime in free secular Iran?
events.description: As Iran's nationwide protests increase the pressure on the Islamic regime and the Ayatollah Khamenei, Nadia Massih is pleased to welcome Dr. Ammar Maleki, Director/Founder of GAMAAN research foundation and Professor of Political Science at Tilburg University. Dr. Maleki breaks down the protests in Iran into a broader sociopolitical and historical context: Widespread public dissatisfaction linked to decades of brutal repression, multiple economic crises and a faltering regime severely weakened regionally and globally.

events.title: Myanmar vote a ‘facade’ to entrench military rule, independent rights expert says
events.description: An independent human rights expert has urged the international community to reject the electoral process organised by Myanmar’s military government, after the first round of voting revealed widespread coercion, exclusion and violence.

events.title: World News in Brief: Fighting intensifies in Syria’s Aleppo and South Sudan’s Jonglei state, acute hunger in Niger
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres continues to be gravely alarmed by escalating hostilities in Aleppo, Syria, and mounting reports of civilian casualties, his Spokesperson said on Thursday.

events.title: ICE agents report ‘unprecedented’ 3,200% surge in car attacks last year
events.description: DHS reported an unprecedented 3,200% surge in vehicular attacks on ICE agents over the past year, with assaults up 1,300% and death threats rising 8,000%.

events.title: Trump’s attack leaves China worried about its interests in Venezuela | Amy Hawkins
events.description: Maduro had just affirmed ‘strong bonds of brotherhood’ with Beijing when US made its shocking intervention Venezuela crisis – latest updates Hours before his life and the fate of his country was changed dramatically, Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, was exchanging smiles and handshakes with a Chinese delegation in the presidential palace in Caracas. On Friday evening, shortly before he was seized by US forces , Maduro wrote on Telegram of his meeting with China’s special envoy for Latin American affairs, Qiu Xiaoqi: “A fraternal meeting that reaffirms the strong bonds of brotherhood and friendship between China and Venezuela. Through thick and thin!” Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Toughest conditions imaginable’: Victorians urged to shelter inside from heatwave as tropical cyclone heads for Queensland
events.description: Heatwave warnings in place for nearly all states and territories as Sydney braces for 43C forecast on Saturday Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Victorians have been urged to stay inside as Melbourne’s mercury soared past 42C amid a heatwave engulfing much of Australia to descend on Sydney on Saturday. Anthony Albanese met officials in Canberra for a briefing on the extreme conditions and said these were “difficult times” for the country. Continue reading...

events.title: 1,000 days of war in Sudan: 70% of population in need as key cities bombed
events.description: A thousand days of war in Sudan has left millions deprived, displaced and longing for a political solution to the disastrous armed violence tearing the country apart.

events.title: Iran ready to fight back if US or Israel attacks again, says foreign minister
events.description: Iran's foreign minister says his country does not want war with Israel or the U.S., but is ready to fight back if attacked

events.title: Renee Good’s wife claimed Minneapolis shooting was ‘my fault’ in video amid anti-ICE fury
events.description: Fatal shooting by federal agents in Minneapolis sparks controversy as Noem alleges victim was "stalking" ICE officers while family disputes claims.

events.title: Iran protests spread nationwide as NGO reports dozens killed
events.description: The demonstrations, which were sparked by anger over the rising cost of living, have been met with a crackdown by Iran's Islamic regime. Donald Trump has said the US will hit Iran "very hard" if protesters are killed.

events.title: Syria announces Aleppo ceasefire after deadly clashes force thousands to flee
events.description: Syria’s defence ministry announced a ceasefire in Aleppo on Friday after days of clashes between government forces and Kurdish fighters that killed at least 21 people and displaced thousands, the worst violence since Islamist authorities took power last year. The army has been battling the U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces since Tuesday.

events.title: Syria live: Ceasefire ends in Aleppo after at least 22 killed since Tuesday
events.description: Syria's Defence Ministry has announced a ceasefire in Aleppo neighbourhoods after fighting killed 22 people.

events.title: US Border patrol agents shoot and wound 2 in Portland
events.description: Two people were shot and wounded by US federal agents in Portland, Oregon, authorities said. It comes a day after a US citizen was shot dead in Minneapolis, sparking major protests.

events.title: UN’s ‘responsibility to deliver’ will not waver, after US announces withdrawal from dozens of international organizations
events.description: Secretary-General António Guterres has expressed regret over the decision by the United States to withdraw from a number of UN entities, while underscoring that the system will continue to deliver on all its mandates.

events.title: Thirteen more lives lost in Sudan as 1,000th day of war looms
events.description: Thirteen more lives – including children – were reportedly lost on Tuesday in another drone attack on Sudan’s North Kordofan region.

events.title: Maduro seized, norms tested: Security Council divided as Venezuela crisis deepens
events.description: The UN Security Council met on Monday against a sharply altered diplomatic backdrop, following US strikes on the Venezuelan capital and seizure of President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Venezuela says 100 were killed in US operation to capture Maduro: report
events.description: Venezuelan official claims 100 killed in U.S. operation to capture President Nicolás Maduro, while Cuba reports 32 of its forces died in weekend mission.

events.title: Russian winter strike leaves nearly 800K homes without power and heat in Ukraine’s Dnipro region
events.description: Russia's overnight attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure leaves nearly 800,000 homes without power amid freezing winter temperatures across the country.

events.title: Australians brace for 'property loss or worse' as bushfires destroy homes
events.description: All regions in Victoria are facing 'catastrophic' or 'extreme' fire warnings

events.title: Sudan in need of urgent aid as it marks 1,000 days of war: NGOs
events.description: Fierce fighting and global funding cuts have pushed more than 33 million people towards starvation.

events.title: Landfill collapse kills one and leaves dozens missing in Philippines
events.description: Rescuers retrieve eight people alive and are searching for more missing in Binaliw, Cebu city.

events.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 13 in Gaza, including children, civil defence says
events.description: Israel strikes in Gaza on Thursday killed at least 13 people, including five children, the Hamas-run civil defence agency said, despite a ceasefire that has largely halted fighting. A drone hit a tent for displaced people in the south, killing four, while separate strikes killed others across the Gaza Strip.

events.title: Somalia denies US allegation that it destroyed food aid warehouse
events.description: Somalia’s government is denying an allegation by the U.S. government that authorities in Mogadishu destroyed an American-funded warehouse belonging to the World Food Program

events.title: Chinese national charged with photographing US stealth bomber base after illegal entry
events.description: A Chinese national allegedly photographed a U.S. Air Force stealth bomber base after illegally entering the country in 2023, now faces federal charges in Missouri.

events.title: NASA administrator orders early return of 4 Crew-11 astronauts following medical situation
events.description: NASA is brining an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station after a crew member experienced a medical issue. The agency stressed the situation is stable.

events.title: Iran regime said to unleash Hezbollah and Iraqi militias as uprising spreads
events.description: Iran’s regime is accused of importing foreign militias to crush protests, as experts warn the move marks a dangerous escalation to suppress domestic unrest.

events.title: ‘Peace’ on paper, but catastrophe continues on the ground in Gaza
events.description: Despite an agreed-upon ‘peace plan’, Israel continues to violate the ceasefire.

events.title: Brazilian president vetoes bill reducing Jair Bolsonaro’s prison sentence
events.description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva rejects bill passed by congress as he marks anniversary of 2023 Brasília riots Brazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, has vetoed a bill that would dramatically reduce the prison sentence of the country’s far-right former leader Jair Bolsonaro, who was convicted last year of plotting a coup. Lula vetoed the bill, which was passed by congress in December, on the third anniversary of riots by Bolsonaro supporters in the capital, Brasília, over his defeat by Lula in the 2022 general election. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Catastrophic' Australian bushfires force evacuations and school closures
events.description: Uncontrolled bushfires raged in the Australian state of Victoria on Thursday, forcing communities to evacuate and hundreds of schools to close.

events.title: Two starkly opposed Americas laid bare by deadly ICE shooting
events.description: The incident is threatening to inflame a deeply contentious debate over immigration enforcement.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Snow and ice ground flights and choke highways in parts of Europe
events.description: More than 1,000 stranded passengers spent the night at Amsterdam's international airport as snow and ice that is pummeling parts of Europe grounded hundreds of flights.

events.title: Trump invites Colombian president to White House after threatening his country with military strike
events.description: President Donald Trump abruptly changed his tone Wednesday about his Colombian counterpart, Gustavo Petro, saying they had exchanged a friendly phone call and he'd even invited the leader of the South American country to the White House.

events.title: US has 'legal obligation' to pay dues, UN tells Trump
events.description: The US abruptly announced its withdrawal from 66 international organizations on Wednesday — around half of which were UN bodies. Now, Antonio Guterres has reminded the Trump administration of its financial obligations.

events.title: UK, France strike new Ukraine security pact as US takes lead in ceasefire enforcement
events.description: Coalition of the Willing signs Ukraine security agreement with U.S. support, establishing multinational force and ceasefire monitoring mechanism.

events.title: Street protests grow in Iran as the country faces an internet blackout
events.description: Protests across Iran are growing as thousands of people voice anger at the dire state of the country’s economy.

events.title: What does the US raid in Venezuela mean for China’s designs on Taiwan?
events.description: Perception that Chinese-made weapons could not stop a ‘decapitation strike’ may give Beijing pause for thought The sight of a hostile regional superpower launching an overnight raid to depose the leader of a smaller neighbouring country could easily have sent pulses in Taiwan racing. The US on Saturday revealed the details of a surprise raid to capture Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro , who was whisked away to the US, where he was frogmarched into a court in New York on Monday . Continue reading...

events.title: Syria: Fighting between Kurds and Damascus raise fears of wider war
events.description: Deadly fighting between Kurdish forces and Syria's national army in Aleppo has led to new widespread displacement. As thousands flee amid shelling, can US, Turkish, and UN mediators stop a full-scale war?

events.title: Why Germany struggles to fight financial crime
events.description: Germany lacks thousands of state prosecutors to effectively fight organized crime, the German Association of Judges has warned. But others say the judicial system's problems run much deeper than that.

events.title: Crime reporter killed in Mexico's Veracruz state
events.description: A reporter covering crime in Mexico’s Gulf coast state of Veracruz has been killed in Poza Rica

events.title: Iraq ‘unrecognisable and remarkable’ after years of conflict: UN coordinator
events.description: Some two decades after a shaky political transition, Iraq today is a country “at peace, with increased security and a clear determination to win the battle of development,” says the UN resident coordinator for Iraq on Wednesday.

events.title: Minneapolis ICE shooting agitators set up camp, barricade roads as schools, businesses close in city on edge
events.description: Minneapolis schools close for about 30,000 students after ICE agent shoots woman. Businesses shut down as city braces for widespread protests.

events.title: Enraged anti-ICE professors slam America, demand 'Nuremberg' trials for agents: ‘Moderate position’
events.description: Academics call for abolishing ICE after Minneapolis shooting kills woman. Professors use inflammatory language, compare federal agents to Nazis.

events.title: Iran regime cuts nationwide internet access as protests claim 44 lives across major cities
events.description: Iranian protests sparked by a currency collapse evolved into a broader uprising demanding regime overthrow, with demonstrators torching government buildings across provinces.

events.title: Minnesota officials say FBI blocked their access to ICE shooting probe
events.description: Hundreds of people have taken to the streets of Minneapolis to protest the killing of 37-year-old Renee Good.

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing political detainees to ‘consolidate peace’
events.description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado hails move to tackle ‘injustice’ as Spain’s foreign ministry confirms release of five Spanish nationals Five days after the US seized Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela has announced it is releasing an “important number” of detainees in what the congressional president characterised as a gesture to “consolidate peace”. Former opposition candidate Enrique Márquez was among those released from prison, according to an opposition statement. “It’s all over now,” Márquez said in a video taken by a local journalist who accompanied him and his wife, as well as another opposition member Biagio Pilieri, who was also released. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia: 3 missing as 'catastrophic' fires rage amid heat wave
events.description: The bushfires ignited as an intense heat wave swept southern Australia, creating the most dangerous conditions since the "Black Summer" blazes from late 2019 to early 2020.

events.title: Russia strikes Ukraine with Oreshnik hypersonic missile
events.description: Russia said it deployed one of its most advanced ballistic missiles during massive overnight strikes on Ukraine. In Kyiv, 4 people were killed by drones. DW has more.

events.title: 🔴 Live: Russia says it fired Oreshnik hypersonic missile in massive attack on Ukraine
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Switzerland marks day of mourning for victims of Crans-Montana fire tragedy
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron joins his Swiss and Italian counterparts in the town of Martigny for a memorial ceremony on Friday as Switzerland marks a day of national mourning for the dozens of victims, most of them teenagers, of the devastating New Year bar blaze in Crans-Montana. Watch the ceremony live on FRANCE 24 from 1:45pm local time (GMT+1).

events.title: M23 rebel group holds a symbolic funeral for victims of drone strike in eastern Congo
events.description: The Rwanda-backed M23 rebel group has held a symbolic burial for 22 people killed in a drone strike in eastern Congo

events.title: Minnesota Bureau of Criminal Apprehension drops out of ICE-involved shooting investigation
events.description: Minnesota BCA withdraws from ICE shooting investigation, claiming it was told by the FBI that it would "no longer have access to the case materials."

events.title: Iranian protesters rename Tehran street after Trump, plead 'don't let them kill us' amid crackdown
events.description: Iranian protesters appeal to President Donald Trump amid nationwide demonstrations against the regime, with reports of deadly crackdowns and arrests across cities.

events.title: Huge anti-government protests in Tehran and other Iranian cities, videos show
events.description: Rallies on major roads in the capital and in Iran's second city were peaceful and not dispersed by security forces.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Anger in Papua New Guinea after Starlink ordered to shut down internet services
events.description: In mid-December PNG said the company did not have a licence to operate in the country and ordered it to halt operations Frustration is growing in Papua New Guinea weeks after the government ordered Starlink to shut down operations in the country as businesses, health providers and communities struggle without access to internet services. Starlink, owned by Elon Musk’s SpaceX, is a satellite internet company that provides internet to remote places. In mid-December, the National Information and Communications Technology Authority (Nicta) ordered the company to halt operations because it was not licensed in PNG. Continue reading...

events.title: Greenland: Vance warns Europe to take Trump 'seriously'
events.description: Europe should take Donald Trump "seriously" on the issue of Greenland, warned US Vice President JD Vance, as Trump's advisers met with envoys from Denmark and Greenland.

events.title: Farmers block highways across Greece in protest over rising costs and EU trade deal
events.description: Farmers in Greece have escalated nationwide protests by launching a 48-hour blockade of major highways and toll stations

events.title: Watch: Buildings in Tehran set on fire as demonstrations spread across Iran
events.description: In video verified by BBC Persian, protesters in Iran can be heard chanting anti-government slogans.

events.title: Bowen: Trump risks pushing world back to age of empires
events.description: Donald Trump wants and needs quick victories. Taking Maduro is the decisive win he has craved, writes Jeremy Bowen.

events.title: Ukraine calls on allies to raise pressure as Russia fires Oreshnik missile
events.description: Kyiv labelled the use of the weapon close to the EU and NATO border a 'grave threat' to European security.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: Alleged scam kingpin Chen Zhi arrives in China after extradition from Cambodia
events.description: Chen founded multinational conglomerate Prince Group that US says is front for multibillion-dollar fraud operation Chinese television has shown footage of the US-indicted tycoon Chen Zhi being escorted by armed police after his extradition to China from Cambodia, where authorities on Thursday ordered the liquidation of a bank he founded linked to a massive “scam centre” network. Chen, who chairs a conglomerate the US says is a front for a multibillion-dollar online fraud operation, was shown in handcuffs and hooded as he was led off a plane at a Beijing airport by black-clad Swat officers, with the state broadcaster CCTV describing him as the “leader of a major transnational gambling and fraud crime syndicate”. Continue reading...

events.title: Global growth to slow in 2026 as tariffs and geopolitical tensions rise, UN says
events.description: The United Nations forecast global economic growth of 2.7% this year, down from last year’s estimate, citing higher US tariffs, policy uncertainty and geopolitical tensions. UN economists see growth rising to 2.9% in 2027, still below the 2010-19 average of 3.2%. Growth is seen at 2.8% in 2025.

events.title: How far will Iran protests go?
events.description: Iran’s biggest protests since the Women, Life, Freedom movement of 2022 extending everywhere from Tehran’s grand bazaar to remote villages throughout the 31 provinces.

events.title: One dead and 38 missing after landfill collapse sends avalanche of rubbish into village
events.description: One person has died and 38 others are missing after a landfill collapse in the Philippines.

events.title: Fox News ‘Antisemitism Exposed’ Newsletter: Rubio takes aim at Israel's enemies in Venezuela
events.description: Fox News' "Antisemitism Exposed" newsletter brings you stories on the rising anti-Jewish prejudice across the U.S. and the world.

events.title: Pope Leo calls for Christians to treat foreigners with kindness as he closes Catholic Holy Year
events.description: Pope Leo XIV closed the Catholic Church's Holy Year by calling on Christians around the world to help those in need and treat foreigners with kindness.

events.title: Colombia sees 'real threat' of US military action, president tells BBC
events.description: Gustavo Petro tells the BBC's Ione Wells that the United States is treating other nations as part of a US "empire", after Trump threatened Colombia with military action.

events.title: Conservative lawmaker in Honduras injured after being hit with explosive
events.description: The incident underscores the tense political environment in Honduras in the wake of its contested presidential election.

events.title: Somaliland recognition: Israel’s foothold in the Horn of Africa
events.description: Critics view Israel's moves in the Horn of Africa as part of Netanyahu's expansive conflict and influence agenda.

events.title: Jazz close out Mavericks to end 5-game losing streak; Pacers beat Hornets
events.description: Anthony Edwards becomes third-youngest player in NBA to reach 10,000 career points as Wolves hold off Cavs.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,415
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,415 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: ‘We just sit and cry’: Gaza’s cancer patients die waiting for treatment
events.description: Gaza cancer deaths triple as doctors say Israel allows entry of 'chocolates and chips" but blocks chemotherapy drugs.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: ‘Shadow fleet’ ships moving sanctioned oil reflagged to Russia at rising rate
events.description: Lloyd’s List analysis suggests 40 suspicious vessels joined Russian registry last year, with 17 reflagged last month Two oil tankers under US sanctions sailing through Channel towards Russia Forty ships accused of belonging to a large “shadow fleet” moving sanctioned oil for Venezuela and others were reflagged to Russia last year in an apparent attempt to gain Kremlin protection from American seizure. Analysis by the shipping intelligence publication Lloyd’s List suggests that of those, at least 17 suspicious vessels joined the Russian registry over the past month, compared with 15 ships in the previous five months of 2025. Continue reading...

events.title: Russia says it used new Oreshnik ballistic missile against Ukraine
events.description: Russian media said the Oreshnik targeted a huge underground natural gas storage in Ukraine's western Lviv region. Ukrainian officials said four people were killed in Kyiv overnight.

events.title: Fact check: Trump claim about Minneapolis ICE shooting false
events.description: An ICE agent has shot a woman dead in Minneapolis. US President Donald Trump claims she tried to run him over. DW Fact check has analyzed two videos, and explains why Trump's assertion is clearly false.

events.title: Syria: Thousands flee Aleppo fighting between army, Kurds
events.description: Thousands of civilians left affected areas of Aleppo as the army launched strikes on Kurdish forces. The government declared a curfew, as the fighting disrupted flights, shops, universities and schools.

events.title: EU-Jordan summit signals Brussels' bid for influence in a volatile Middle East
events.description: The first EU-Jordan summit in Amman underscores Europe's bid to reassert influence in a region shaped by war and displacement.

events.title: With Maduro gone, the US looks to drive Hezbollah out of Venezuela
events.description: Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro’s capture also marks an advance towards the US goal of uprooting Lebanese Shiite group Hezbollah from Latin America, where the movement stands accused of criminal activities linked to drug trafficking, arms sales and money laundering. Washington has warned that it will no longer tolerate the presence of Hezbollah or its Iranian backers in Venezuela.

events.title: US detains Ghana's fugitive former finance minister
events.description: In tonight's edition, Ghana fugitive ex-finance minister is held by ICE in the US. Also, ahead of election, Uganda's security forces are accused of using violence against the opposition. And as AFCON ramps up for the quarter-finals, we take the temperature of the story so far and thumb ahead to what's still in store.

events.title: UK braced for heavy snow as cold weather snap in Europe persists
events.description: Britain, already in the midst of one of its coldest and longest cold snaps in years, is set to endure heavy snowfall and strong winds that weather authorities have warned could bring a risk to life

events.title: Syria signals renewed cooperation on chemical weapons destruction
events.description: Progress continues to be made towards eliminating remnants of the chemical weapons programme in Syria that was developed under the Assad regime, the UN Security Council heard on Thursday.

events.title: Syria: Aleppo fighting leaves civilians dead, displaces thousands
events.description: At least five civilians have been killed and some 30,000 people displaced following renewed fighting in Aleppo, Syria, prompting calls from the UN for immediate de-escalation and a return to political talks.

events.title: Drones, fear and exhaustion: The daily reality of providing aid to Ukraine
events.description: Almost four years since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, aid teams continue to adapt to the lethal reality of working in a modern war zone.

events.title: UN agency rolls out three-year plan to safeguard Ukraine’s bread basket
events.description: Ukraine’s agricultural sector remains under intense pressure as the war continues to disrupt food production and endanger civilians, the UN food security agency warned on Tuesday, as it unveiled a new three-year plan to help farmers survive and protect their livelihoods.

events.title: Naked woman allegedly assaults deputy while intoxicated, claims she was ‘trying to be a mermaid'
events.description: A Louisiana woman allegedly attacked a sheriff’s deputy after skinny-dipping in a neighbor’s pond and claiming she was “trying to be a mermaid," authorities said.

events.title: ICE confirms arrest of Somali illegal immigrant sex offender in Minneapolis
events.description: ICE agents arrest Somali illegal immigrant convicted sex offender Mahad Abdulkadir Yusuf, who has an active warrant, in a targeted Minneapolis operation.

events.title: Security guard fatally shot outside Houston restaurant after confrontation with suspect
events.description: Security guard fatally shot outside Houston restaurant after confrontation, authorities said. Suspect fled scene as police review surveillance footage.

events.title: Russia warns Western forces in Ukraine would be considered 'legitimate combat targets'
events.description: Russia warns Western forces deployed to Ukraine under postwar security deal would be "legitimate combat targets" as diplomatic tensions escalate.

events.title: Cuba identifies 32 military personnel killed in US operation against Maduro regime in Venezuela
events.description: Havana says 32 members of its armed forces died during a U.S. military operation to capture Nicolás Maduro, calling it an act of aggression.

events.title: What life is like in Venezuela's capital after the removal of Nicolas Maduro
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to a man in Caracas about life in the city following the U.S. removing former Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: US involvement in Venezuela could last years, Trump says
events.description: The US president says only time would tell how long his administration will be involved in the running of the country.

events.title: Heavy fighting in Aleppo, Syria, after talks with SDF collapse
events.description: Clashes began in Aleppo after talks on integrating the Syrian Democratic Forces into the national army stalled.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Venezuela cooperating fully and US will control its oil for years, Trump claims
events.description: US president says Delcy Rodríguez’s interim administration is doing ‘everything that we feel is necessary’ The US is receiving full cooperation from Venezuela’s regime and will control the country and its vast oil reserves for years, Donald Trump has claimed. Caracas was giving Washington “everything that we feel is necessary” and the US would remain a political overlord there for an indefinite period, the US president said. Continue reading...

events.title: Storm Goretti lashes France with fierce winds, cuts power to 380,000 households
events.description: Some 380,000 homes in France were without electricity on Friday as Storm Goretti battered swathes of northern Europe, packing winds of more than 200 kilometres per hour and bringing further travel disruption after a week of heavy snowfall.

events.title: Political prisoners are being freed from a brutal jail in Caracas. This is significant
events.description: It's the shape of a three-sided pyramid - originally built to become a shopping mall in Venezuela's capital Caracas - but El Helicoide has for years been a sinister prison, headquarters of the secret police and famous for the torture of its inmates.

events.title: Reviving Venezuela's oil industry may be harder than Trump thinks
events.description: Oil sits at the heart of Donald Trump's Venezuelan gamble. Within a day of the US operation which ousted President Nicolas Maduro, Trump made his top priority clear: reviving the country's oil industry.

events.title: 'Extremely dangerous situation': Ex-Danish PM reacts to US 'act of aggression' over Greenland
events.description: The former prime minister of Denmark has told Sky News her country is "being bullied" by the US over Greenland, and that it views this as "an act of aggression".

events.title: Filipino Catholics express outrage over corruption scandal during massive religious procession
events.description: A massive crowd of mostly barefoot Filipino Catholics is joining an annual procession of a centuries-old statue of Jesus Christ in the Philippine capital, with some using the gathering to express outrage over a corruption scandal involving influential ...

events.title: Venezuela to release a 'significant number' of prisoners as gesture to 'seek peace'
events.description: Venezuela plans to release a "significant number" of prisoners, both Venezuelan and foreign, according to the head of the national assembly

events.title: Russian drone strikes cause major blackouts in two regions of Ukraine
events.description: Russian drone strikes have knocked out power in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region and left over 600,000 households in Dnipropetrovsk without electricity

events.title: Bishops and Spanish government agree on a plan to compensate sexual abuse victims
events.description: Spain’s government and the country’s Catholic bishops have agreed to a joint plan to compensate victims of sexual abuse by clergy members who have died or whose possible crimes have been proscribed

events.title: Venezuela’s people must be heard, insists UN human rights chief
events.description: Responding to the seizure of Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro by the United States, UN human rights chief Volker Türk on Tuesday reiterated deep concerns that the military operation undermined fundamental protections for sovereign countries.

events.title: Venezuelan ‘dark fleet’ tanker evades US Coast Guard as Russia sends submarine to escort vessel: reports
events.description: Russia formally asked the United States to halt pursuit of Venezuelan oil tanker Marinera after the vessel escaped U.S. Coast Guard interception in the Caribbean.

events.title: Ukraine hit with rarely-used Oreshnik missile in fresh strikes, Russia says
events.description: It is only the second time Moscow has deployed the hypersonic ballistic missile, which was first used to hit Dnipro in November.

events.title: 'How do we look Indian?': Student's killing puts spotlight on racism in India
events.description: The murder of Anjel Chakma has triggered protests in India and revived demands for an anti-racism law.

events.title: Trump will not meet Iran’s ‘Crown Prince’ Pahlavi as protests intensify
events.description: US president signals he is not ready to back the Israel-aligned opposition figure to lead Iran in case of regime change.

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Brazil's Lula vetoes bill to reduce Bolsonaro's jail term
events.description: The Brazilian president announced his decision on the anniversary of the 2023 riots by Jair Bolsonaro supporters. The former far-right leader is serving a prison sentence for attempting a coup.

events.title: EU set to pass Mercosur deal after last ditch concessions seem to convince Italy
events.description: The EU is set to pass a trade deal with South American trade bloc Mercosur after Brussels unveiled new concessions this week. HSBC has agreed to pay nearly 268 million euros to the French treasury to settle up a case over fraud on dividend tax payments. And, protest from hundreds of UK pubs over higher business rates seems to have convinced lawmakers.

events.title: What happened on Iran's 'Bloody Saturday'?
events.description: In a place called Malekshahi, in western Iran, protesters converge on a base run by the revolutionary guards.

events.title: Syria announces ceasefire after days of clashes with Kurdish fighters in Aleppo
events.description: Syria's Defense Ministry has announced a ceasefire after three days of clashes between government forces and Kurdish fighters in Aleppo

events.title: Russia says it used new Oreshnik ballistic missile against Ukraine
events.description: Russia says the military has used the new Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missile in a strike on Ukraine

events.title: Protesters in South Africa condemn US intervention in Venezuela, call for Maduro's release
events.description: Protesters have gathered outside the U.S. Embassy in South Africa to oppose U.S. intervention in Venezuela and the capture of former president Nicolas Maduro

events.title: Ukraine: New strikes disrupt basic services for millions
events.description: Several parts of Ukraine were hit by a new wave of Russian strikes between Wednesday and Thursday morning.

events.title: Winter storms upended thousands in Gaza
events.description: Some 65,000 households in the Gaza Strip were affected by the severe winter storms that whipped through the enclave last month, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Venezuela teeters as guerrilla groups, cartels exploit Maduro power vacuum
events.description: Criminal networks including Tren de Aragua cartel and ELN guerrillas exploit power vacuum in Venezuela after former President Nicolás Maduro's arrest, threatening transition efforts.

events.title: Is the Eastern Mediterranean becoming Israel’s new front against Turkiye?
events.description: Turkiye closely monitoring Israel’s regional manoeuvres in the Eastern Mediterranean as tensions widen.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Man extradited from Cambodia to China suspected of running online criminal empire
events.description: Prosecutors in the United States say Chen Zhi boasted of pulling in $30 million a day

events.title: Crane removes Hampton Inn by Hilton sign from Minnesota hotel that allegedly denied service to DHS, ICE agents
events.description: Photos captured a crane removing a Hampton Inn sign from a hotel in the Minneapolis area that allegedly refused to accommodate ICE and DHS agents.

events.title: Hungary's Orbán says Budapest is Europe’s safest city for Jews as antisemitism surges
events.description: Hungarian PM Viktor Orbán claims Jewish communities are safer in Budapest than elsewhere in Europe, amid ADL reports of sharp rise in antisemitic incidents.

events.title: Influential China church reports arrests as crackdown on Christians intensifies
events.description: Leaders of Early Rain Covenant Church have been arrested and Yayang Church is being torn down, groups say.

events.title: Spain's Catholic Church signs deal on sexual abuse compensation
events.description: The accord follows complaints that religious leaders had failed to tackle the issue adequately.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Mexico boasts sharp decline in homicides, but analysts urge caution
events.description: The Mexican government reports a sharp decline in homicide rates, claiming its security strategy is working

events.title: Florida man accused of killing woman, dumping body on popular tourist destination: report
events.description: Florida man allegedly kills woman, leaves body on Hollywood Beach day after Christmas. Brandon McCray, 28, faces multiple charges including sexual battery.

events.title: European allies working on plan if US acts on acquiring Greenland: report
events.description: Countries in Europe reportedly are working on a plan if the Trump administration makes a move on acquiring Greenland, which is a a Danish territory.

events.title: Mobs of motorcycle-riding armed militia hunt Venezuelan streets for Trump supporters as crackdown intensifies
events.description: Venezuela crackdown intensifies as Diosdado Cabello leads paramilitary groups following Nicolás Maduro's reported capture, with armed colectivos conducting searches.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Venezuelan government begins releasing political prisoners
events.description: The US, which recently captured its President Nicolás Maduro, has long demanded the detainees be freed.

events.title: Vance criticises Denmark and Europe's handling of 'critical' Greenland
events.description: European allies of Denmark have rejected Trump's ideas to annex the semi-autonomous territory.

events.title: Trump withdraws US from key climate treaty and dozens of other groups
events.description: The White House says the decision was taken because those entities "no longer serve American interests".

events.title: Tennis Kenya admits it shouldn't have let amateur compete after viral defeat
events.description: The organisers of a professional women's tournament which has gone viral because of a wildcard player's poor performance acknowledge she should not have been allowed to play.

events.title: The secret mission to fly a president's body back home - pilot speaks to the BBC
events.description: An ex-air force pilot explains how he carried out an undercover mission to fly Siad Barre's body home for burial.

events.title: Analysis: Why Trump chose Maduro's VP over Nobel winner
events.description: What is it about Delcy Rodríguez that caught the eye of the Trump administration?

events.title: Venezuela releases imprisoned political figures in Trump-approved move
events.description: Former Venezuelan opposition candidate Enrique Marquez is among 'large number' of prisoners released.

events.title: Europe should prepare for Greenland’s annexation and end of NATO: Experts
events.description: US and Russian ideologies would be in alignment, leaving Europe as an island of liberalism, according to analysts.

events.title: What is Chavismo – and is it dead after US abduction of Venezuela’s Maduro?
events.description: The sociopolitical ideology founded by former Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez is rooted in anti-imperialism.

events.title: Brazil’s President Lula vetoes bill to trim Bolsonaro prison sentence
events.description: The opposition-controlled Congress voted in December to pass a bill that would reduce Bolsonaro's 27-year sentence.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: 'Tuna King' pays record £2.4m for giant bluefin at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura will turn prized 243kg fish into sushi rolls selling for £2.4o at his restaurant chain A sushi entrepreneur has paid a record 510.3m yen (£2.4m) for a giant bluefin tuna at a prestigious auction in Tokyo’s main fish market. Kiyoshi Kimura, who styles himself the “Tuna King”, paid the top price for the 243kg (536lbs) specimen, which was caught off Japan’s northern coast. Continue reading...

events.title: 'The atmosphere is very authoritarian': Venezuela's opposition reels from the sidelines
events.description: President Trump sidelined Venezuela's opposition and is working with remnants of the regime led by ousted leader Nicolás Maduro. What's next for the opposition?

events.title: U.S. seizes tanker that raised Russian flag after weeks-long chase in North Atlantic
events.description: The U.S. seized an oil tanker in the North Atlantic after a two-week pursuit spanning thousands of miles from the Caribbean. During the chase, the vessel changed its name and raised a Russian flag.

events.title: A closer look at Venezuela's new leadership
events.description: Other than President Maduro, Venezuela's new leadership looks a lot like the old. We look at who's in charge.

events.title: U.S. forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker once bound for Venezuela
events.description: After a two-week chase, U.S. forces seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic. The tanker was originally bound for Venezuela but had changed course to avoid the U.S. ships.

events.title: Venezuela begins releasing opposition figures
events.description: The interim government has released several high-profile detainees, a move the US says came at its request. Meanwhile, President Donald Trump is preparing to host oil executives at the White House.

events.title: Venezuela says it will free 'important number' of prisoners
events.description: The brother of Venezuela's interim leader, Delcy Rodriguez, didn't say how many political prisoners would be released. Meanwhile, the US Senate has voted to curb further military operations in Venezuela by Donald Trump.

events.title: Baa-rgain hunters: 50 sheep barge into German supermarket
events.description: German discount chain Penny said the sheep paid a surprise visit to one of their Bavarian outlets after apparently becoming separated from the rest of the flock.

events.title: China–Japan rift deepens over dual‑use goods export ban
events.description: The two Asian giants are locked in an escalating row triggered by Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi commenting on security challenges linked to Taiwan.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.description: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: Venezuela releases political prisoners in move Trump says US 'requested'
events.description: Venezuela has begun releasing a "large number" of political prisoners, including high-profile opposition figures and several foreigners, in what US President Donald Trump described as a move requested by Washington following its capture of ruler Nicolas Maduro.

events.title: Trophée des champions: Paris Saint-Germain Edge Marseille in nail-biting Classic
events.description: After a wild night of drama, Paris Saint-Germain claimed their first trophy of the year at Marseille’s expense, prevailing 2-2 before winning 4-1 on penalties. The Parisians kick off 2026 in style, lifting a record-extending 14th Trophée des champions, their 12th in the last 13 editions.

events.title: Starmer says 'more could be done to protect' the Arctic in call to Trump
events.description: Sir Keir Starmer has said "more could be done to protect" the Arctic region and agreed with Donald Trump on the "need to deter an increasingly aggressive Russia in the High North" during his second call in two days with the US president, Downing Street has said.

events.title: US senators vote to curb Trump's ability to take more Venezuela military action
events.description: The US Senate has voted for legislation that would bar Donald Trump from taking further military action against Venezuela without authorisation from Congress.

events.title: Brazil’s Lula vetoes bill that could reduce Bolsonaro’s prison time
events.description: Brazil’s President Lula da Silva has vetoed a bill that could reduce Jair Bolsonaro’s 27-year prison sentence for his failed 2023 coup attempt

events.title: Lebanese pop star turned militant Fadel Shaker tells court he is innocent
events.description: A Lebanese pop star turned Islamic militant has claimed innocence in a military court

events.title: Russia frees French political scholar in a prisoner swap for a basketball player
events.description: A Russian security agency says French political scholar Laurent Vinatier who was serving a three-year sentence in Russia and facing new charges of espionage has been freed in a prisoner swap with France

events.title: Denmark sees talks with US as a chance for 'dialogue that is needed' over Greenland
events.description: Denmark has welcomed a meeting with the U.S. next week to discuss the Trump administration's renewed interest in acquiring Greenland

events.title: Aid continues despite winter hardship in Gaza and West Bank, UN says
events.description: Despite harsh winter conditions and continuing access constraints, the UN and partners are maintaining large-scale humanitarian operations in Gaza and the occupied West Bank, with a focus on shelter, water, health and education.

events.title: 550-pound bear finally evicted from California home after bizarre strategy ends monthlong ordeal
events.description: A massive black bear caused thousands in damage while living beneath a California home for weeks before wildlife specialists finally removed the animal.

events.title: Noem says Trump administration is 'on offense,' using 'every single tool that we have' to protect Americans
events.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said Thursday that the Trump administration "is using every single tool that we have to protect the American people."

events.title: UK keeps billions in Venezuelan gold reserves frozen at Bank of England after Maduro arrest
events.description: Bank of England keeps billions in Venezuelan gold frozen since 2020 amid legal battle following Nicolás Maduro's arrest and interim leader appointment.

events.title: Christians targeted in systematic kidnapping campaign in Nigeria by jihadi herdsmen, experts say
events.description: One Nigerian church paid $205,000 ransom for 50 kidnapped members as Fulani militants allegedly wage economic jihad against Christians in Middle Belt.

events.title: 'Irregular' armed guards aboard Russian shadow tankers alarm Nordic-Baltic governments
events.description: Russia demands humane treatment of the crew aboard the seized oil tanker Marinera, and the White House says the Venezuelan shadow fleet vessel faces prosecution.

events.title: US military seizes two sanctioned tankers in Atlantic Ocean
events.description: U.S. forces seized the Russian-flagged oil tanker in dramatic North Atlantic operation targeting sanctioned Venezuelan oil shipments.
